comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: The line past Abbeyleix was single track. This had to be very near the station, streetview here. You can see the short stretch of double and triple track on the OS 25" map here.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: I think I see the digits 79 on the loco. According to Wikipedia, the Waterford, Limerick and Western Railway had only one loco with digits 79 on it, the 1899 0-4-4T WLWR 27, renumbered 279 when the line was acquired by the GS&WR.

comment.author: 68262918@N00
comment._content:
It's not a WL&WR loco at all, it's Midland Great Western no 79, the 'flyaway' cab (possibly a primitive attempt at deflecting smoke out of drivers view) small worksplate on cabside and brass numerals on the sandbox are giveaways. Taking a guess here, but imagine it's named 'MAYO'. The date of 1943 is incorrect, the vast majority of locos taken over by the GSR lost their nameplates and worksplates and were re-painted dark grey and re-numbered very shortly after takeover in 1925. The very last MGWR loco to retain its livery and plates was called 'LUNA' and they got removed sometime around the 30's.
From the look of the photo, I'd date it around the 1910's/20's.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/68262918@N00] See description above: "Bit of a cheat adding this as the pic for 31 July, as we believe that the original photo was taken long before 1943, but this copy was certainly produced on 31 July 1943!" That comes from our Year in the Life project, and it was the only image I could find in our collections for that day... But thanks very much for all of the train information!
